What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit <FI>is there<Fi> of circumcision?
Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.
For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?
God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, <FO>That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.<Fo>
But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say? <FI>Is<Fi> God unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)
God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?
For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?
And not <FI>rather<Fi>, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.
What then? are we better <FI>than they<Fi>? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;<RF>proved: Gr. charged<Rf>
As it is written, <FO>There is none righteous, no, not one:<Fo>
<FO>There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.<Fo>
<FO>They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.<Fo>
<FO>Their throat <FI>is<Fi> an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps <FI>is<Fi> under their lips:<Fo>
<FO>Whose mouth <FI>is<Fi> full of cursing and bitterness:<Fo>
<FO>Their feet <FI>are<Fi> swift to shed blood:<Fo>
<FO>Destruction and misery <FI>are<Fi> in their ways:<Fo>
<FO>And the way of peace have they not known:<Fo>
<FO>There is no fear of God before their eyes.<Fo><CM>

Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.<RF>guiltyâ€¦: or, subject to the judgment of God<Rf>
Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law <FI>is<Fi> the knowledge of sin.
But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;
Even the righteousness of God <FI>which is<Fi> by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:
For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;
Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:

Whom God hath set forth <FI>to be<Fi> a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;<RF>set forth: or, foreordained<Rf><RF>remission: or, passing over<Rf>
To declare, <FI>I say<Fi>, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.
Where <FI>is<Fi> boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.
Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.
<FI>Is he<Fi> the God of the Jews only? <FI>is he<Fi> not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:
Seeing <FI>it is<Fi> one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.
Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.<CM>
